storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to view conflict history logs to audit scheduling issues

testCases.title: Verify all conflicts are logged with complete details
preconditions: Administrator account with valid credentials exists
Admin portal is accessible and operational
Conflict event database is configured and running
At least one schedulable resource exists in the system
Test environment is in a clean state with no existing conflicts

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by attempting to book the same resource for overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and prevents the double booking

steps.action: Create a second scheduling conflict by booking a resource that is already assigned to another event
steps.expectedResult: System detects the second conflict and prevents the booking

steps.action: Create a third scheduling conflict by attempting to schedule a user who is already scheduled elsewhere
steps.expectedResult: System detects the third conflict and prevents the scheduling

steps.action: Verify conflicts are recorded in the log database by checking database entries directly or via monitoring tools
steps.expectedResult: All three conflicts are recorded in the conflict event database with timestamps, user details, resource information, and conflict type

steps.action: Log into the admin portal using administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and is redirected to the admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict history section from the admin menu
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history page loads successfully displaying the conflict logs interface

steps.action: Query the conflict logs to retrieve all logged conflicts
steps.expectedResult: All three triggered conflicts appear in the conflict logs with complete details including timestamp, user ID, resource ID, conflict type, and description

steps.action: Verify each conflict entry contains all required fields: timestamp, user details, resource information, conflict type, and resolution status
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict log entry displays all required fields with accurate and complete information

postconditions: All triggered conflicts remain logged in the database
Conflict logs are accessible for future auditing
Administrator session can be safely terminated
System state is ready for subsequent tests

testCases.title: Test administrator access control to conflict logs
preconditions: Admin portal is accessible and operational
Administrator account with valid credentials exists
Non-administrator user account with valid credentials exists
Role-based access control is configured and enabled
Conflict logs contain at least one conflict entry
API endpoint GET /api/admin/conflicts is active

steps.action: Log into the system using non-administrator user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Non-admin user successfully logs in and is redirected to the standard user dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the conflict logs section by entering the admin conflict history URL directly
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user receives an appropriate error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs via API by sending GET request to /api/admin/conflicts using non-admin user authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating unauthorized access

steps.action: Verify that no conflict log data is exposed in the error response
steps.expectedResult: Error response contains no sensitive conflict log information

steps.action: Log out the non-admin user from the system
steps.expectedResult: Non-admin user is successfully logged out and session is terminated

steps.action: Log into the admin portal using administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and is redirected to the admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict history section from the admin menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and conflict history page loads successfully

steps.action: Verify conflict logs are displayed with all conflict entries visible
steps.expectedResult: All conflict logs are displayed with complete details and administrator has full access to view, search, and filter functionality

steps.action: Send GET request to /api/admin/conflicts using administrator authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 200 OK status code with complete conflict log data in JSON format

postconditions: Non-admin user access denial is logged in security audit logs
Administrator access is logged in system audit logs
All user sessions are properly terminated
Access control mechanisms remain enforced
System security posture is maintained

testCases.title: Validate export functionality for conflict logs
preconditions: Administrator account with valid credentials exists
Admin portal is accessible and operational
Conflict logs contain at least 5 conflict entries for meaningful export testing
Export functionality is enabled in the system
Administrator has necessary permissions to export data
System supports CSV and PDF export formats

steps.action: Log into the admin portal using administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and is redirected to the admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict history section from the admin menu
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history page loads successfully displaying conflict logs with export options visible

steps.action: Verify that conflict logs are displayed and contain multiple entries
steps.expectedResult: At least 5 conflict log entries are visible in the interface

steps.action: Locate and click the export option button in the conflict logs UI
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears showing CSV and PDF format options

steps.action: Select CSV format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: System initiates CSV export process and download begins

steps.action: Wait for CSV file download to complete and verify file is saved successfully
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is downloaded successfully with appropriate filename containing timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all conflict log entries with proper column headers and data formatting

steps.action: Verify CSV content includes all required fields: timestamp, user details, resource information, conflict type, and description
steps.expectedResult: All required fields are present in CSV with accurate data matching the displayed logs

steps.action: Return to the conflict logs interface and click the export option button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears showing CSV and PDF format options

steps.action: Select PDF format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF export process and download begins

steps.action: Wait for PDF file download to complete and verify file is saved successfully
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded successfully with appropriate filename containing timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays conflict logs in a well-formatted, readable layout

steps.action: Verify PDF content includes all required fields and matches the data displayed in the interface
steps.expectedResult: All conflict log entries are present in PDF with complete details, proper formatting, headers, and page layout

postconditions: CSV and PDF export files are successfully saved to local storage
Exported files contain accurate and complete conflict log data
Export actions are logged in system audit logs
Administrator session remains active
System is ready for additional export operations

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want suggested resolution options for conflicts to resolve issues quickly

testCases.title: Verify generation of resolution suggestions for conflicts
preconditions: Scheduler account with valid credentials exists
Scheduling system is accessible and operational
At least one resource is available for booking
Alternative time slots and resources exist in the system
Suggestion generation engine is configured and running
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/suggestions is active
System performance monitoring tools are available

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system using scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler successfully logs in and is redirected to the scheduling dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation interface
steps.expectedResult: Booking creation form loads successfully with all required fields visible

steps.action: Create an initial booking by selecting a resource, date, and time slot, then save the booking
steps.expectedResult: Initial booking is created successfully and confirmed in the system

steps.action: Start a timer and attempt to create a second booking with the same resource and overlapping time slot to trigger a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and displays a conflict alert

steps.action: Stop the timer and verify the time elapsed for suggestion generation
steps.expectedResult: System generates resolution suggestions within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Verify that the conflict alert interface displays the generated suggestions
steps.expectedResult: Suggestions are displayed alongside the conflict alert in a clear, accessible format

steps.action: Review the suggestions to verify they include alternative time slots
steps.expectedResult: At least one suggestion provides an alternative time slot that does not conflict with existing bookings

steps.action: Review the suggestions to verify they include alternative resources
steps.expectedResult: At least one suggestion provides an alternative resource available for the requested time slot

steps.action: Verify each suggested alternative time slot by checking against existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: All suggested time slots are verified to be conflict-free and available

steps.action: Verify each suggested alternative resource by checking availability status
steps.expectedResult: All suggested resources are verified to be available and conflict-free for the proposed time

postconditions: Conflict remains unresolved until scheduler takes action
Generated suggestions remain available for scheduler review
Initial booking remains active in the system
System is ready for scheduler to apply a suggestion
Performance metrics for suggestion generation are logged

testCases.title: Test application of a suggested resolution
preconditions: Scheduler account with valid credentials exists and is logged in
A scheduling conflict has been triggered
System has generated at least one valid resolution suggestion
Conflict alert with suggestions is displayed to the scheduler
Original conflicting booking exists in the system
Suggested alternatives have been verified as conflict-free

steps.action: Review the displayed resolution suggestions in the conflict alert interface
steps.expectedResult: Multiple resolution suggestions are visible with clear descriptions of alternative time slots or resources

steps.action: Select the first suggested resolution option by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Selected suggestion is highlighted and an 'Apply' or 'Accept' button becomes active

steps.action: Click the 'Apply' button to apply the selected suggestion
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a confirmation message

steps.action: Verify that the booking is updated according to the selected suggestion
steps.expectedResult: Booking details are updated with the new time slot or resource as suggested, and changes are reflected in the booking interface

steps.action: Navigate to the booking list or calendar view to verify the updated booking
steps.expectedResult: Updated booking appears in the schedule with the new time slot or resource assignment

steps.action: Verify that the original conflicting booking remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Original booking is still present with its original time slot and resource assignment

steps.action: Trigger the system's conflict validation process by refreshing the schedule or running a conflict check
steps.expectedResult: System initiates validation process to check for any remaining conflicts

steps.action: Review the validation results to confirm no conflicts are detected
steps.expectedResult: System confirms that no conflicts exist between the updated booking and any other bookings in the schedule

steps.action: Verify that no conflict alerts or warnings are displayed for the updated booking
steps.expectedResult: No conflict indicators appear for either the original or updated booking

steps.action: Check the booking status to ensure it is marked as confirmed and active
steps.expectedResult: Updated booking status shows as confirmed with no pending conflicts

postconditions: Booking is successfully updated with the applied suggestion
No scheduling conflicts exist in the system
Both original and updated bookings are active and confirmed
Conflict resolution action is logged in system audit logs
Schedule integrity is maintained
System is ready for new booking operations

testCases.title: Ensure suggestion generation performance under 2 seconds
preconditions: Scheduler account with valid credentials exists
Scheduling system is accessible and operational
Multiple resources and time slots are available in the system
Performance monitoring tools are configured and active
System is under normal load conditions
Accurate time measurement capability is available
Suggestion generation engine is running optimally

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system using scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler successfully logs in and is redirected to the scheduling dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation interface
steps.expectedResult: Booking creation form loads successfully

steps.action: Create an initial booking to establish a conflict scenario
steps.expectedResult: Initial booking is created and saved successfully

steps.action: Prepare performance monitoring tool or timer to measure response time accurately
steps.expectedResult: Timer is ready and synchronized with system clock

steps.action: Start the timer immediately before triggering the conflict by attempting to create an overlapping booking
steps.expectedResult: Timer starts recording and conflict is triggered simultaneously

steps.action: Submit the conflicting booking request to the system
steps.expectedResult: System receives the request and begins conflict detection and suggestion generation process

steps.action: Monitor the system response and stop the timer when suggestions are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Timer stops when resolution suggestions appear in the interface

steps.action: Record the elapsed time from conflict trigger to suggestion display
steps.expectedResult: Elapsed time is captured accurately in milliseconds or seconds

steps.action: Verify that the elapsed time is less than or equal to 2 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Measured time is 2.0 seconds or less, meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Verify that suggestions returned are valid and complete
steps.expectedResult: All suggestions include necessary details such as alternative time slots or resources

steps.action: Repeat the test by triggering another conflict with different parameters
steps.expectedResult: Second conflict is triggered successfully

steps.action: Measure the suggestion generation time for the second conflict
steps.expectedResult: Second measurement also shows suggestion generation within 2 seconds

steps.action: Trigger a third conflict scenario and measure performance
steps.expectedResult: Third measurement confirms consistent performance under 2 seconds

steps.action: Calculate the average suggestion generation time across all three tests
steps.expectedResult: Average time is calculated and documented, confirming consistent performance under 2 seconds

postconditions: Performance metrics are documented and logged
System demonstrates consistent suggestion generation within 2-second requirement
All test conflicts remain in the system for potential cleanup
Performance baseline is established for future monitoring
System performance meets acceptance criteria

storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to override scheduling restrictions to resolve critical conflicts

testCases.title: Verify administrator can override scheduling restrictions
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role
Administrator has override permissions enabled
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
Admin interface is accessible
Audit logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the admin interface and access the override functionality
steps.expectedResult: Override UI is displayed with list of available conflicts and override controls

steps.action: Select a specific scheduling conflict from the list
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details are displayed including affected resources, users, and time slots

steps.action: Click on the 'Override' button for the selected conflict
steps.expectedResult: Justification input dialog appears with mandatory text field

steps.action: Enter valid justification text (e.g., 'Critical business requirement - CEO meeting needs this room') in the justification field
steps.expectedResult: Justification text is accepted and 'Confirm Override' button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click 'Confirm Override' button to apply the override
steps.expectedResult: Override action is accepted and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the conflict restriction is lifted in the scheduling system
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is resolved and the restricted slot is now available

steps.action: Check the audit log for the override entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains new entry with administrator username, timestamp, conflict ID, and justification text

postconditions: Scheduling restriction is successfully overridden
Override action is logged in audit system with complete details
Conflict status is updated to 'Overridden' in the database
System reflects the override within 1 second

testCases.title: Ensure affected users receive notifications after override
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role
Administrator has override permissions enabled
Scheduling conflict exists with identified affected users/schedulers
Notification system is operational
Affected users have valid email addresses or notification preferences configured

steps.action: Navigate to admin interface and select a scheduling conflict that affects multiple users
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details are displayed showing list of affected users/schedulers

steps.action: Click 'Override' button and enter justification text (e.g., 'Emergency maintenance required')
steps.expectedResult: Justification is accepted and override confirmation dialog appears

steps.action: Confirm and apply the override action
steps.expectedResult: Override is successfully applied and confirmation message states 'Override applied. Notifications will be sent to affected users.'

steps.action: Wait for up to 5 minutes and check the notification queue/logs
steps.expectedResult: Notification system shows notifications queued or sent to all affected users

steps.action: Log in as one of the affected users and check notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received containing override details, justification, and administrator information within 5 minutes

steps.action: Verify notification content includes conflict details, override reason, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains complete information: conflict ID, affected schedule, override justification, administrator name, and timestamp

postconditions: All affected users have received notifications within 5 minutes
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Users are informed of the scheduling change and justification
Notification status is marked as 'Delivered' in the system

testCases.title: Test override access control enforcement
preconditions: User is logged in with non-administrator role (e.g., Regular User, Scheduler, Viewer)
User does NOT have override permissions
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
Access control system is properly configured
Role-based permissions are enforced

steps.action: As a non-admin user, attempt to navigate to the admin override interface URL directly
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is redirected to unauthorized access page or error page is displayed

steps.action: Check if override controls are visible in the regular scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Override buttons and controls are not visible to non-admin users

steps.action: Attempt to send a direct API request to POST /api/admin/override endpoint with conflict ID and justification
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'Access denied: Administrator privileges required'

steps.action: Verify the error message displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message is shown: 'You do not have permission to override scheduling restrictions. Please contact an administrator.'

steps.action: Check audit logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Audit log records the failed override attempt with user ID, timestamp, and 'Access Denied' status

steps.action: Verify that no changes were made to the scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict remains unchanged and restriction is still in place

postconditions: Override action is blocked for non-admin user
Scheduling restrictions remain unchanged
Unauthorized access attempt is logged in audit system
No notifications are sent to affected users
System security is maintained
